title: [BUG] NaiveForecaster will fail if trained on numpy array and forecasting horizon is np.arange starting with zero
body:
**Describe the bug**
When NaiveForecaster is trained on an numpy array and forecast horizon is np.arange(0,x) it will fail with 
```python
ValueError: y_preds must be a list of pd.Series or pd.DataFrame
```
I am not sure, if in this case the execution should fail or not. However, the error message is confusing for me. Note: When training on pd.DataFrames it will not fail.


<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->

**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->

```python
from sktime.forecasting.naive import NaiveForecaster
import numpy as np
y = np.random.random(1000)
forecaster = NaiveForecaster()
forecaster.fit(y)
forecaster.predict(np.arange(0,10))
```

The following line with a pandas DataFrame will not fail

```python
from sktime.forecasting.naive import NaiveForecaster
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
y = pd.DataFrame(np.random.random(1000))
forecaster = NaiveForecaster()
forecaster.fit(y)
print(forecaster.predict(np.arange(0,10)))
```

**Expected behavior**
The code does not fail or the error message is more helpful

**Additional context**
It seems to be related to the NaiveForecaster since ARIMA does not have this problem. The following lines of code will not fail

```python
from sktime.forecasting.arima import ARIMA
import numpy as np
y = np.random.random(1000)
forecaster = ARIMA()
forecaster.fit(y)
forecaster.predict(np.arange(0,10))
```
